text:
About this site

title: ISSS608-VAA
text: Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Applications homepage. In this website, you will find my coursework prepared for this course.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p-load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p-load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Dotplot(with y-axis)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_dotplot(dotsize = 0.5)

Bin width defaults to 1/30 of the range of the data. Pick better value with
`binwidth`.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Dotplot(turn-off y-axis)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_dotplot(binwidth = 2.5,
               dotsize = 0.5) +
  scale_y_continuous(NULL,
                     breaks = NULL)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Histogram (default bin is 30)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram()

`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Histogram (changeing geom())

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 color = "black",
                 fill = "light blue")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Histogram (changeing aes())

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = ENGLISH,
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20,
                 color = "grey30")

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Density

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = ENGLISH,
           color = CLASS)) +
  geom_density()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Boxplot (with notch)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = ENGLISH,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot(notch = TRUE)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Violin (Comparing multiple data distribution)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = ENGLISH,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_violin()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Point

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = ENGLISH,
           y = MATHS)) +
  geom_point()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Combine (“jitter” refers to a technique used to add small random bariation to data points)
text:
Combine (“jitter” refers to a technique used to add small random bariation to data points)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = ENGLISH,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(position = "jitter",
             size = 0.5)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Stat (After)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = ENGLISH,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",
               fun.y = "mean",
               colour = "red",
               size = 4)

Warning: The `fun.y` argument of `stat_summary()` is deprecated as of ggplot2 3.3.0.
ℹ Please use the `fun` argument instead.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Add curve on a scatterplot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = ENGLISH, x = MATHS)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(size = 0.5)

Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.


`geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Facet_wrap

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20) +
  facet_wrap(~ CLASS)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Facet_grid

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20) +
  facet_grid(~ CLASS)

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Working with coordinate (after)

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Changing the y- and x-axis range (before)
text:
Changing the y- and x-axis range (before)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, size=0.5)

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
section: Changing the y- and x-axis range (after)
text:
Changing the y- and x-axis range (after)

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, size=0.5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100),
                  ylim = c(0,100))

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Classic

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_classic()

title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
Minimal

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal()
